Marcus Greer.Action: Gives clear, direct instructions to Rodrigo to ensure everyone's safety during a dangerous act, shows control and leadership.
Uses harsh, threatening language towards Rodrigo, showing little tolerance or friendliness.
Presses an Uzi against Rodrigo’s temple and threatens to shoot if provoked, then confidently directs the group to proceed with the robbery.
Efficiently fills a duffel bag with cash from the counting machine, demonstrating speed and skill during the robbery.

Insists on leaving immediately despite Bama wanting to take Lottos.
Remains a passive observer during a heated confrontation between experienced dealers without intervening or escalating, showing awareness and restraint.

Trusts Katrina’s protection and openly communicates.

Asks his mother to get an Atari, demonstrating understanding of negotiation and positive interaction with her.

Raps with friends, sharing a passion for music that reflects their lives.

Takes rap seriously and actually works at improving his skill.
Raps with colorful, clever, and very talented verses, showing skill and confidence at a young age.

Speaks kindly to Michael, offers to take him to Playland.
Hands Michael back to Charlene after a brief interaction, avoids discussing feelings openly.
Confronts Tyrell violently with a gun, accuses him of betrayal.
Almost smiles at Tyrell before sparing his life by firing an empty gun clip.
Tells Tyrell that 'The streets’ll take care of you' and dismisses him harshly.
Shoots Tyrell dead when Tyrell attempts to shoot him from behind.
Kisses Charlene and Michael goodbye and says he will call when he arrives, showing care for loved ones.
Converses confidently on the phone about flight details and managing his group at the airport.
Passes through airport security with his bag without issue, indicating awareness and preparation.
